parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate.  The event advertised is a discussion about football and its community-building aspects. While the speakers hold positions related to football clubs, this is not connected to the parliamentary elections.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and targets a wide audience interested in football and community events in Arad. The link directs to a subscription page, suggesting a broader reach beyond personal communication.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to promote an event discussing the social impact of football, not to influence votes in the parliamentary elections. There is no mention of any political candidate or party, nor any attempt to sway public opinion towards a specific electoral outcome.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The event could be considered a form of public discourse or citizen journalism, focusing on a social issue (the role of football in community building). The speakers are relevant figures in the local football scene, making their participation relevant to the topic.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post doesn't express personal opinions; it promotes a public event.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1772161040220138</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes a public event discussing the community-building aspects of football.  The event features speakers who are presidents of local football clubs, but the content itself is not related to the parliamentary elections. The post does not mention any political candidates or parties, nor does it attempt to influence voting behavior.  Therefore, it does not meet the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006 and Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>MCC</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
